definition: dove faction (opposite: 鹰派, hawks)/peace party/the faction seeking peace
clique/school/group/faction/to dispatch/to send/to assign/to appoint/pi (Greek letter Ππ)/the circular ratio pi = 3.1415926/(loanword) pie

sentences.english: Livni is based on domestic doves , that ease the Palestinian-Israeli conflict.
sentences.chinese: 利夫尼是以国内的鸽派，主张缓和巴以冲突。

sentences.english: But, on balance, the dovish rhetoric seems stronger.
sentences.chinese: 但总的看下来，美联储内部的鸽派声音似乎更强。

sentences.english: The discord cuts across party lines and is not between traditional hawks and doves.
sentences.chinese: 这一分歧横跨两党，也非传统的鹰派和鸽派分歧。

sentences.english: The dovish Labor Party, on the other hand, supports the freeze.
sentences.chinese: 相反地，鸽派工党支持冻结令。

sentences.english: "I did not moult from a hawk into a dove, " says Mr Gates.
sentences.chinese: 我可没有从鹰派蜕变成鸽派。

sentences.english: Yet the doves are soon eclipsed in his book by Roosevelt.
sentences.chinese: 不过在书中，罗斯福很快让鸽派人士黯然失色。

sentences.english: Is the Kremlin turning dovish in its most recent confrontation with the West?
sentences.chinese: 在最近与西方的对峙中，克里姆林宫要变鸽派了？

definition: hawk faction (opposite: 鸽派, doves)/fierce and combative party/war party/warmongers
US Federal Reserve (Fed), the US central bank
abbr. for various central banks, notably 中國人民銀行|中国人民银行[Zhong1 guo2 Ren2 min2 Yin2 hang2] and 中央銀行|中央银行[Zhong1 yang1 Yin2 hang2]
Bernanke (name)/Ben Shalom Bernanke (1953-), US economist, Chairman of Fed from 2006
